author: thecatalystschool
title: Insight Sharing Workshops - TCS
description: Os membros Catalyst lutam para aproveitar ao máximo a etapa do Insight Sharing para melhorar sua consciência sobre os desafios.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is quite interesting because via this insight sharing workshop, proposers could better understand the challenge scope and the key elements required to successfully propose.

It provides knowledge for new proposers in Project Catalyst to understand more in which challenge they can submit their proposal or even getting answer for their question. I think, this is a good forum/place where people could interact and produce better idea for Cardano community. 

The key metrics and goal of this proposal also align with the challenge settings. It would like to increase the number of proposal and also active participation from community.
f6_assessments.q1: The team consists of experienced people in Project Catalyst, such as: Felix, Tevo and Victor Corcino. And The Catalyst School are already given several workshops to about Project Catalyst. In my opinion, if funded, this proposal will be implemented successfully. Moreover, budget is outlined clearly and broken down properly. And the sum is still reasonable in my opinion. The team could also include timeline or milestone, so the voter could understand the time frame, if it's mentioned in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team described the targeted problem clearly. And community could track the project progress via Catalyst School website and via their Discord server. The KPI, I think it's quite clear & easy to be measured accordingly.

For the community to audit or track the progress, they could check the latest update via Catalyst School Twitter & Discord.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal aims to create workshops focused on the Insight sharing phase. From my experience as a community member in the Cardano ecosystem, the insight sharing phase has been viewed as the most abstract part of the "Catalyst wheel" by many community members (as described in the problem statement).
Having experienced community members hosting high quality workshops to give this more clarity is not only beneficial for the ecosystem as a whole, but a very good long term investment of future participants, proposers and community members. The proposal presents a clearly stated problem, a well defined solution and show a deep understanding of the Project Catalyst as a whole. It'll be useful for both people already involved in Catalyst (CAs, vCas) and proposers. Both new and experienced. 
I strongly agree that this proposal addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of extremely experienced and well known members of the Catalyst Community, being involved in all different levels of organization and governance. (Details are provided clearly in the proposal)
The fact that they already have launched similar workshops but with different focus further speaks to the probability of the workshops being carried through successfully. Budget allocation is very minimal since this project isn't too heavy relying on developers, extra hirings or massive scale, etc. It seems to be a large investment for a relatively small project. The plan to achieve the goal of educating the attendees is presented step by step, with a description of each step and its purposes.  The budget allocation is more than reasonable and the working hours seems to correlate with this as well. 
I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes a clear roadmap with estimated timeframes, especially since the proposal initially is operating on a shorter span of time.  The team aims to use the active members attending the workshops as measurements of success, which will be shared with the community from the start (if these workshops are intended to work as previous ones), which will make it highly transparent. There is not much said about the potential risks and challenges by implementing this project, which might be (If I'm allowed to speculate) because of the small scale of the initial project or goal the team aims to achieve. I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely The Catalyst members struggle to take full advantage of the Insight Sharing stage to improve their awareness about challenges.
 
It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by Hosting challenge-specific workshops with domain experts and in collaboration with Challenge Team during the Insight Sharing stage
 
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by hosting challenge-specific workshops with domain experts and in collaboration with Challenge Team during the Insight Sharing stage
 
  Key metrics  would be  Total number of community members who get involved with the Insight Sharing workshops
Number of proposers joining the workshops
Number of CAs joining the workshops
Number of vCAs joining the workshops
Number of new voters joining the workshops
 
The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
   
Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more Workshops under more challenges. As each funding brings new challenges, more workshops would be run, one or more for each challenge. 

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the competency of Catalyst members to get awareness of challenges. 

I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 5 star rating.


I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have provided ample evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  hosting Town Hall and After Town Hall events as well as managing the documentation process for these events.
  
 The links are sufficient. 
 
I have visited these links and contacted the relevant people
   
The proposers are well experienced and competent to do the event.
 
 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is stated.
 
 
The team structure is listed and experienced.
 
 
 The budget has   been given in detail. 
 
The budget is  reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required  
 

There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 
 
 
Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work
 
 
The proposal gives  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  . 
Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   
  
The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 
 
The proposer has not  identified risks in this 


Given experience and plan presented it is  highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is reasonable hence I have given it a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones  
 

 There are  Metrics such of Total number of community members who get involved with the Insight Sharing workshops
Number of proposers joining the workshops
Number of CAs joining the workshops
Number of vCAs joining the workshops
Number of new voters joining the workshops
 
The problem has been clearly understood and solution has been given in much detail.
  
 
    The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties other than what would happen if he werent able to do this in future. He has a solution for that which is creditable
  
 THere are no contingency plans in place for various outcomes

Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.


The information provided is  sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a  5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
Hosting challenge-specific workshops with domain experts will help a lot to members to fulfill the awareness about challenges, therefore affect a lot to the development of Catalyst team and project in each fund. This idea is essential for the development of Cardano ecosystem that proved by previous funds. 
As their key metrics show when this event be held, it will increase not just proposers to join, but also CA, vCA and voter will increase to help. All of these objects is aligned which what challenge points.
f6_assessments.q1: The team had held this activity in fund 6, fund 7 already. So, no doubt that they can do it in fund 8 successfully. They are 9 people that are very familiar with Catalyst community, that with a diverse background, and are passionate about Catalyst and education. They have a well-explanation about what will happen in this event that helps the roadmap make sense. About the budget, is reasonable with their 1-week event plan.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team has enough roadmap detail and key metrics that help to audit this project easily. 
They also have a well aware about the problem context and make a better solution by time to help improve Catalyst development. And that is very easy to understand what they gonna do.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is essential to the achievement of Cardano's mission of enabling, facilitating, and innovating progress in the blockchain space. Moreover, every human disregarding race should have the same amount of opportunity to contribute and feel deserved in an organization or society. We are all constantly building ourselves and finding ways to communicate with each other, thus increasing diversity in the Catalyst. The proposal will be indeed a helpful asset for new users, be it entrepreneurs, developers and others from all over the world to join forces without any fear of rejection. The team are people that has played their roles, given their time and effort to provide knowledge and support into the community. I feel that this workshop is important to propel further towards a better and brighter future for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: I have been in the Catalyst School discord for several months and one of the team members have been very helpful in answering questions and giving support for new comers (like me). The success metrics and roadmap for upcoming Fund8 are clearly stated. This proposal of insight sharing workshops will be very useful for having more quality and innovative experience within the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The fund required seems very reasonable as the proposers are contributing their time and effort to give education and experience. I am very new and was lucky to be a CA, and I believe knowledge is important and understanding what goes about in every Project Catalyst Fund will be a good way to give quality assessments. Since they are recording and tracking the success metrics, I believe the auditability will be simple as follows.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Insight Sharing Workshops proposed by the Catalyst School provides an opportunity to demystify the Catalyst funding challenges and in doing so provide entry points for people who are not familiar with Cardano or Catalyst funding challenges. The impact of this would be a deeper understanding of each challenge, and potentially lead to project ideas that are more informed and remove an important barrier of access to new people - knowledge and understanding of Cardano. 

Insight Sharing Workshops would be hosted on the Catalyst School Youtube channel making it widely and globally accessible. The scalability of this particular project is limited however the aims are succinct and very likely to assist in the further development and reach of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst School has already successfully won and delivered on projects previously, is made up of a large team of 9 highly skilled collaborators and is asking for a modest investment to execute the managable project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success of this project is being measured by the participation numbers of community members involved in theworkshops, and the volume of proposers, CA's, VCA's and new voters joining the workshops. There are no specific targets for involvement which leaves little room to articulate the success of the project in terms of the ambitions of the project team, which might be something to look at in future iterations or proposals. 

The timing of this project is determined by the announcement of Fund 8 challenges.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very good. The proposal is actually geared towards tackling the challenge. There is a very strong problem-challenge relationship, and for that reason I salute this team. The metrics also corresponds with the challenge. The fact that the proposal seeks to give insight to catalyst members is great going to add value to the cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1:
This team have taken part in Fund 6 and even earlier project catalyst and have also even gone ahead to share workshops they held online, and for this I think they are experienced and well equipped with the necessary skills.
The team members are also clearly stated and known. The budget is also clearly stated and I like the fact that the team has further broken it into identifiable items.
However, the proposer has not included possible risks/challenges involved in the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and milestone for the execution of the propyosal are clearly stated. The metrics to the success of the proposal is seen under the "Success metric" heading. Also the approach of the team actually tackles the problem in the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great with a well-written proposal. I think this proposal addresses the problem effectively by educating more individuals to explore the full potential of the challenges. It would be interesting to get new individuals on board as well, to help expand the catalyst to many who may not necessarily be existing members in the catalyst community
f6_assessments.q1: The team is great with experienced educationists. Again the proposal is specific on hosting 4 workshops to educate individuals on challenges. I think this is realistic and achievable and should be voted for.
f6_assessments.q2: It is easy to track the number of individuals joining the workshop as proposers, CAs, vCAs etc. The impact of the workshop would contribute directly to the catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a laudable and welcome idea as it aims to create awareness and engagements within the community about one of the core steps of project Catalyst and thus address the need to create active participation from the community about this specific process in the ecosytem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team are provably, capable and experienced community members that have been moderated and hosted such past successfully community events. Given the information provided, there is a detailed  budget breakdown with specifically defined roadmaps and/or milestones to be followed to ensure effective implementation of the proposal
f6_assessments.q2: The success metrics provided is sufficient and reasonably effective to assess the progress and success of the proposal. However, i think that the number of Insight sharing participation from the community during the insight sharing stage compared to prior funding cycles, should be included as part of the success metrics

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is thought-through and a hands-on approach to solving the given problem. Indeed, a challenge-specific workshop at this stage would help proposers improve their work while they can still edit it, and allows for opportunities of collaboration between proposers, or even for mentoring.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has abundant relevant experience, which is incorporated in the strong proposal. The team itself is an example for pairing members from different backgrounds and different levels of experience with Cardano - which would happen during their proposed workshops, as well. Incentives for inviting external workshop speakers/experts could be added.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is clear about measurable progress and success, timeline, budget and KPIs are in line with the proposal, and seem very realistic.

solution: Organizar workshops específicos de desafios com especialistas de domínio e em colaboração com a equipe de desafios durante a fase de Compartilhamento de Informações.
experience: Consultores veteranos e mentores de propostas, profissionais da educação, membros muito ativos da comunidade catalizadora desde os primeiros fundos e muito mais.
